solution_line_template: For {num_walls_type2} of the walls, Elijah will need {num_walls_type2} walls * {width_wall_type2} meters each = <<{num_walls_type2}*{width_wall_type2}={tape_for_type2_walls}>>{tape_for_type2_walls} meters of masking tape.

For the other {num_walls_type1} walls, he will need {num_walls_type1} walls * {width_wall_type1} meters each = <<{num_walls_type1}*{width_wall_type1}={tape_for_type1_walls}>>{tape_for_type1_walls} meters of masking tape.
He will therefore need a total of {tape_for_type2_walls} + {tape_for_type1_walls} = <<{tape_for_type2_walls}+{tape_for_type1_walls}={total_tape_needed}>>{total_tape_needed} meters of masking tape.
